daa.practice1.randomaccessmachine.io

Class OutputTape

  • java.lang.Object
    • daa.practice1.randomaccessmachine.io.OutputTape

  • public class OutputTape
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that does all the necessary operations with the outputTape. This includes creating the buffer, writing in it and closing it.
    Since:
    12-2-2018
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    √Ångel Igareta

    • Constructor Detail

      • OutputTape

        public OutputTape(java.lang.String outputTapeFilename)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor of the OutputTape class. It initializes the outputTape to a BufferedWriter that can write text to a character-output stream.
        Parameters:
        outputTapeFilename - Name of the file that contains the outputTape.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws an error if the file was not found.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(int numberToWrite)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a line to the buffer that contains text from the outputTape.
        Parameters:
        numberToWrite - String that contains the line that is going to be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws an error if there was a problem writing the number.

      • writeArray

        public void writeArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> outputArray)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the buffer where the input was writing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws an error if there was a problem closing the buffer.
